pr_title: NMA-444: Connect UI to backend Part I: Check username existance

timeline.message: Add dpp, dapi-client, dashpay, platform-core libraries and disable inappmessaging
Connect Platform to background task, live data, view model to getusername data

Use Coroutines based Platform communication model (#382)

* Delay the call of getUsernameViewModel.getUsername(username) until user stop typing

* Updated the incorrect dpp version

* Updated some dependencies in order to be able use androidx.lifecycle:lifecycle-livedata-ktx

* Replaced GetUsernameViewModel with less generic DashPayViewModel which can be used to handle multiple Platform-related LiveDates
Moved the code related to retrieving the data from Platform into PlatformRepo (repository pattern)
Finally replaced Handler based async processing of Platform requests with kotlin coroutines

* Cancel the previous getUsername call if new one arrived
Merge branch 'evonet-username-exists' of http://github.com/dashevo/dash-wallet into evonet-username-exists
Add methods to check for platform availability
Simplified isPlatformAvailableLiveData, upgraded deprecated code and removed temporary debugging change

timeline.bodyText: This old way of retrieving ViewModels is deprecated in 'androidx.core:core:1.2.0', I applied the recommended one.
timeline.author: tomasz-ludek

timeline.bodyText: Last time I forgot to revert this temporary debugging change.
timeline.author: tomasz-ludek

timeline.bodyText: I am curious about this change.  How do we trigger this call?
timeline.author: HashEngineering

replies.bodyText:
It is trigger automatically by the SDK when you starting observing on it:
dashPayViewModel.isPlatformAvailableLiveData().observe(...)
